newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil to accept FGTS funds in privatizations.
newsitem.headline: Brazil to accept FGTS funds in privatizations.

text.p: Brazilian workers will be allowed soon to use FGTS funds to take part in the country's privatization program, newspapers today said.
Planning Minister Antonio Kandir told O Globo daily the government plans to pay off a six billion real debt with the FGTS fund with bonds which will be accepted in privatization auctions.

The FGTS or Time Served Guarantee Fund is a fund that was created to guarantee compensation for workers in case of dismissal. Currently, employees can use the money from the FGTS fund for home purchase or retirements.
The proposal for the use of FGTS funds in privatizations will be discussed by the National Privatization Council (CND) which meets today in Brasilia, O Globo said.
The CND will also discuss a proposed model for the privatization of Brazilian mining conglomerate Companhia Vale do Rio Doce.
The meeting is scheduled to begin at 1500 local time/1400 EDT/1800 GMT.
